page.title: 13The Meeting House,Gt.Ayton.
page.content: The{meeting house}is situated on{High {Green.}When full it will seat 200 to 300 people.The land was bought in 1700 and the{meeting house}was built in 1722.The{meeting house}has its own {clerk}who is nominated.His or her term of office is 3 years.The{clerk}records the minutes and deals with any paper work.The job is voluntary.Inside the {meeting house}the benches face one way towards the clerk and the elders.The meeting house is part of the boarding and day school run by the{Society Of {Friends}and has its own Sunday school held in Ivy cottage.Behind the meeting house there is a graveyard with large trees.Quaker services are often silent.The silence is only broken when someone feels a need to say something which will help the worship.
